review:
You know what? I am going to say it.

Buzz was not a bad host. Far from it.

He just wanted to be as cool as his cousin, hence why he imitated him a lot. And when he broke through that character it was adorable.

The ride only furthered my love.

He better make a cameo expierence in YDKJ Full Stream 2 or I will riot.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042406453', 'num_games_owned': 1063, 'num_reviews': 752, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1674160831}
review:
[quote]For more puzzle game reviews, news and everything puzzle-related, follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/25928931-Puzzle-Lovers/]Puzzle Lovers[/url] and check out our [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/puzzlelovers]Steam group[/url].[/quote]

[b]you don't know jack[/b] is the best trivia game series of all time. this one is from 1996, so it's pretty outdated by now and [b]it's always been us-centric[/b], so you'll either find it very challenging or very frustrating if you're from somewhere else. or a piece of cake because you know all the answers.

it's your typical multiple choice deal, but there are [b]a ton of other question types over the series[/b], like dis or dat (or sometimes both) or gibberish question. you can play a game of [b]7 or 21 questions[/b], some question types only appear in the full run, but they both end with the [b]jack attack[/b]. there's a clue and you have to match things accordingly.

[b]local multiplayer is available for up to 3 players[/b], you can even screw each other by buzzing in and forcing another player to answer. save for a few occasions way back when, I've always played it alone and always had a blast.

it's all [b]presented as a tv show[/b] (there was an actual short-lived tv show as well, should be on youtube), there's some behind-the-scenes chatter at the beginning, fake commercials at the end (don't you dare skip them!), fake money to win and all that, and [b]the writing is fantastic[/b]. if it was a simple text-based thing, it'd still be excellent stuff, so much creativity, but [b]the voiceovers take it to a whole new level[/b]. lots of characters, one-off or recurring, great hosts, also one-off or recurring, and again, the whole thing is just great.

[b]the attention to detail and variety elevates it even further.[/b] sure, if you play long enough, you'll see repeated questions (though I don't think the game will show them again until you've seen most of them), but there are a lot of different ways to introduce questions, a lot of remarks if you chose the wrong answer or hesitate to enter your name (in which case the host will give you one) or pick a category or answer, a relevant joke for most choices, right or wrong, and of course the commercials, man... the game also starts differently based on the time and date, so on certain holidays, early in the morning, late at night, on friday evening, and so on. and for answers that need typing, you can try some profanities, see what good they do.

[b]there was nothing done to modernize the game[/b] for the steam release, so it runs in 640x480 (a very tiny window with a black background, you can set the .exe to run in that resolution or something closer and fill the screen more with the actual game), there's no steam overlay, there's only a single volume setting (it's fine in this case, though lowering it completely didn't let me raise it again until a restart) and controls aren't rebindable. each player gets a buzz hotkey scattered on the keyboard, the screw is the same for everybody, and if you play alone, no need to buzz and space works just fine for that too.

I literally don't know jack and I've been having fun with the series since it first came out, most of it played alone. if you don't mind questions about older stuff (or that's your specialty) and can handle a lower resolution, definitely pick these up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130377449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1651446830}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029343291', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1704059353}
review:
Die You don't know Jack - Reihe ist Teil meiner Kindheit sowie das beste Quiz-Spiel auf der Welt und das obwohl es vor der Jahrtausendwende herausgebracht wurde. Im Gegensatz zu anderen Quizspielen zeichnete sich You Don't Know Jack (YDKJ) schon damals durch seine Originalit√§t aus und verzichtete dabei auf grafische Opulenz, √ºberzeugte aber mit viel Wortwitz und cleveren Fragen - einfach Zeitlos. Vor allem in einer geselligen Runde der gewisse Spa√ü-Bringer :).
Im Sale f√ºr unter 2,- Euro ist dieses Spiel mehr als geschenkt - totale Kaufempfehlung

P.S.: Auf Steam ist leider nur die englische Version enthalten, deswegen hier ein Link f√ºr den deutschen Patch f√ºr Vol. 2:
https://www.compiware-forum.de/downloads/file/706-you-don-t-know-jack-vol-2-german-patch/

author: {'steamid': '76561199368377112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 28, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1711964909}

author: {'steamid': '76561199084879910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1699388616}
review:
This is the first You Don't Know Jack game that I can recommend to people looking to see where the series came from. 

The main reason being, this game has plenty of variety in the question types you can get, meaning this has way more replayability that volume 1. 

You may be asking, what about the later volumes? Well, all future volumes have quirks which i can see being the reason why one may prefer another volume to this one.

Volume 3, while being an all-around better package, if you want a game to go on longer than 7 questions, a "Three-Way" round will always be thrown in. There is no way around it, and I can understand why that could get grating after a while.

Volume 4 actually has story progression, which is something all future volumes would continue to have in one way or another. I could see this being the reason why one person may dislike that version. As well as the fact that this is the only one of the classic Jacks which removes your ability to pick the category for a question, as the category is picked on boot-up. Meaning you could end up with a game full of duds. 

Volume 5 isn't on Steam, so it doesn't count.

Volume 6 also has story progression, though done in a less intrusive way, forces way more grinding onto the player in order to finish the game. The questions are also noticeably easier. And also, some people would find the pirate character who appears throughout the game quite annoying.

Now, I like all of these games, but I could understand why someone wouldn't like the other volumes, and for that person, this could be their goldilocks scenario.

All-in-all, good game, and a safe bet when choosing a volume of classic Jack.

[I did get this as part of a humble bundle, along with many other Jackbox games, but that didn't affect my review in any way.]

author: {'steamid': '76561198269273589', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1710813056}
review:
This is a fun, but dated trivial game. If you are not over 50, you probably won't get any of the "current event" type questions. There are lots of Classics, Renaissance and other questions that you really should know the answers to. I'd really love if someone would develop a mod to add some modern questions. :-)
The host is insulting as hell but very funny, so be prepared.
Playing alone is great practice, but playing with others is more fun.
I have this game in it's original format, also. But it won't play on Windows 10 properly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354021776', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1709658176}
review:
Ideal only if you're over 40 because of the age of the Qs.
Fun little quiz game with lots of narration and tacky graphics.

Pros
- lots of topics 
- different question types like multiple choice, matching, typing
- punny
- streams well for 2 players over zoom, just share the screen and allow remote control
- multiplayer locally on one keyboard

Cons
- fixed resolution, but at least it's full screen with no scaling issues
- American trivia
- questions are quite aged referencing famous people and TV ads

TIP: Some questions require you to hit the letter assigned to your character shown on the screen. In multiplayer hit the letter to select the player, then the number of the answer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198873315590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1673841267}
review: I personally find this one to be very down the middle as well.  Like Volume 1, it's got the same style, and some of the new things they add are pretty cool, like the celebrity collect calls, and the new fill in the blank question.  As well as the Dis or Dat (A staple in future games).  But some downsides, I'm very unhappy with what I said before and now I fully have an opinion on it.  Buzz is very cringy, some of the stuff he does makes my head nod left and right.  The questions about stardom are cool though.  So if you want a simple fun ydkj game with a Dis or Dat and a Gibberish, and celebrities calling then I would recommend in the end.  Give it a shot.

review: A classic sequel to a classic trivia game. The host may be hated on, but despite that, this felt more like the definitive edition before The Ride was released. You like old trivia and laughing at the same time? Here you go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035454875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1693717002}
review:
I love this game! I have wonderful memories of playing this with my Mom and the steam re-release doesn't disappoint. While I say "re-release", nothing has changed - it's just been updated to run on modern operating systems (I'm on Windows 10.)

The audio is a little old, but there are unique question types - such as the celebrity collect call - that make it fun. The questions are snarky and surprisingly have a "dirty mind" tilt to them - in a great way, but I'd avoid junior high and below.

For new players, this is very much a computer game - not a controller or mouse game, Multi-player is done via a shared keyboard and there are fill-in-the-blank questions where you, yes, have to type (it's pretty forgiving on typos, tho.) This is in many ways a nice reminder of old style multiplayer...you get creative with seating.

This is also a blast to play solo. You get lots of teasing.

When you first launch, the screen will seem very small. An easy fix:
[list]
[*] Right-click the game in your steam library and select "View local files". 
[*] Right click the main program (something similar like YDKJV2.exe and select "properties".
[*] Click the "Compatibility" tab.
[*] In the "Settings" section select the checkbox next to "Run in 640 x 480 screen resolution"
[*] Click Apply, Click OK, launch game from Steam.

While the initial white box won't be full screen, it will quickly flip to full screen. Don't worry, you haven't changed your desktop resolution, and once you quit the game everything will go back to normal. Problem solved!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1532, 'num_reviews': 875, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1517672291}
review:
[h1]YOU DON`T KNOW ENGLISCH 2 [/h1]

Die Spielreihe kam urspr√ºnglich f√ºr die Playstation 1 raus und wurde nun, Jahre sp√§ter, auf Steam ver√∂ffentlicht. Der Daumen geht nach oben, aber bitte das ganze Review lesen, welches stellvertretend f√ºr die gesamte Spielereihe steht!

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Die gesamte ‚ÄúYOU DON`T KNOW JACK‚Äù ‚Äì Reihe ist ein Quizspiel, die sich durch abstrakte Fragen und viel Humor auszeichnet. Man kann ausw√§hlen, ob man alleine oder im Partymodus spielen will und bekommt anschlie√üend 7 oder 21 Fragen gestellt, wobei man aus einer von drei fragw√ºrdigen Kategorien ausw√§hlen darf. Wer den ‚ÄûBuzzer‚Äú dr√ºckt, darf antworten: Ist es Richtig, gibt es die Summe aufs Konto, ansonsten wird sie abgezogen.  Gelegentlich gibt es dann noch Zusatzspiele, wo man Begriffe assoziieren muss und √Ñhnliches. 

[b]Story[/b]
Klar, das Spiel ist eine Quizshow und hat damit keine Geschichte. Allerdings sind die vertonten Stimmen einfach der Hammer und rei√üen st√§ndig sehr geile Witze. Am Ende gibt es auch verst√∂rende und lustige Werbeclips zum Anh√∂ren. Auch die Kategorien sind ziemlich durchgeknallt und die Fragen werden manchmal so merkw√ºrdig und verzweigt gestellt, dass man erstmal √ºberhaupt die Frage herausarbeiten muss. Zudem beinhaltet das Spiel oft Fremdw√∂rter oder √§ltere politische Themen. Hier liegt aber das gro√üe Problem: Das Spiel ist nur auf Englisch verf√ºgbar! Normalerweise keine gro√üe Sache, jedoch werden wie bereits erw√§hnt, viele Fremdw√∂rter benutzt, die man sich auch schon schwer ins Deutsche √ºbersetzen kann und dann noch selten wei√ü, was eigentlich gemeint ist. Zudem zielen geschichtliche, gesellschaftliche und politische Fragen auf die USA ab und nicht wie in meiner Playstationfassung, auf die Deutsche.

[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
Die Aufl√∂sung ist leider nicht einfach so skalierbar, wodurch das Spiel nur in einem kleinen Fenster ge√∂ffnet wird. Ansonsten ist das Spiel grafisch nicht aufwendig, da es zum Einen sehr alt und zum Anderen eben ein Quizspiel ist.
Die Musik klingt sehr flockig nach einer typischen Quizshow und die Vertonung ist in der englischen Version und damals auch in der Deutschen einfach super gewesen.

[b]Fazit[/b]
‚ÄûYOU DON`T KNOW JACK‚Äú ist ein super Spiel, was mich fr√ºher auf der Playstation st√§ndig zum Lachen gebracht hat. Leider wurde die Steamversion nur auf Englisch ver√∂ffentlicht und ich habe wirklich fast alles versucht. Ich habe die deutsche Vertonung im Internet gesucht und habe die Entwickler angeschrieben, jedoch ohne Erfolg. Den ersten Teil kann man allerdings nachgebaut im Browser spielen, den Link werde ich aber hier logischerweise nicht ver√∂ffentlichen.  Auf jeden Fall Danke an diesem Typen, dass er ein super Spiel nachgebaut hat. Wer wirklich gut im Englischen ist, kann sich die Spielreihe gerne anschaffen, ansonsten w√ºrde ich stark davon abraten.
Edit: Mittlerweile gibt es [url=https://www.compiware-forum.de/downloads/file/706-you-don-t-know-jack-vol-2-german-patch/]hier[/url] einen Deutschpatch f√ºr mehrere Teile der Reihe. Man kann es also wieder genie√üen.

Hat dir das Review gefallen? Dann folge mir doch in [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool] meiner Steamgruppe[/url], wo ich meine Reviews als Kurator verfasse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1503353765}
review:
Tags: Casual - Quizzes
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Couch party game where people have to share a keyboard?

Nice tongue in cheek humor and good concept. But made completely obsolete by the Jackbox 2015 remasters that offer proper controller support. More modern pop culture references and a better engine. Removing all DOS-ERA YDKJ for their dated clunkyness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119765006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1486798539}
review: Another great game in the series. Good voice acting and humor, fun categories and qyestions, nicely challenging, and an awesome party game. Really, these games are still among the best party/trivia games to come out of the computer age.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077900189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1658706435}
review: Volume 2 is technically the third stand-alone You Don't Know Jack game, the second being YDKJ Sports.  Much like volume 1, the humor is the driving force behind the game along with the trivia.  A few new features have been added to distinguish it from volume 1, such as the introduction of DisorDat and Celebrity Collect Calls, that keep the game fresh.  Like the previous installment, this is a sound purchase for trivia masters, comedy lovers, and almost anyone else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978997366', 'num_games_owned': 1469, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1693323664}
review:
The one with the bad host. But also the one that introduced the world to the DisOrDat. So it's a hard call. It's still classic Jack, but with the most annoying host in the history of the series. The music is good, though it also pops up in Movies.

So get it if you want ALL the YDKJ games, but don't make it your first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1467689492}
review:
https://youtu.be/Y0RSoqF0hWg

How many different YDKJ games does it take before players start to know enough to surpass the jack quotient?  From the looks of this aging trivia game it's still more than two.

The YDKJ formula is still enjoyable after this many years but the questions are old enough to vote and the restrictive resolution weakens the game as a whole.  Stick to the newer releases for an overall better experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079220935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1710212356}
review: I've had fun playing this game for over 15 years, and it continues to be fun. I enjoy playing the solo games, but I like "screwing" my friends over and forcing them to attempt to answer quetions they don't know the answers to. Jack Attack is probably the thing I'm best at, both with knowledge and with fast fingers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035643084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 6263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4879, 'last_played': 1599922772}
review:
Based on the Lite Retail version of the Windows 95 Promoware on the YDKJ Vol.1 Disc, I used to beat the Lite Version Time & Again. Those were good times for me & the best Volume in the YOU DON'T KNOW JACK CD-ROM Trivia Series.

This game is Twice the funny wrong answers, twice the fun & twice the laughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030933171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1547521268}
review: Honestly the best party game I've ever played.  This is easily the best volume and makes for an awesome drinking game.  The hosts constent insults and epic question phrasing make it really REALLY entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012670246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1427734980}
review: There is nothing quite as fun as gathering friends and/or family and have a go at comedic trivia that's also pretty clever at times, and seeing who can understand what they are asking about. So many good times...

author: {'steamid': '76561198043346855', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 630, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1573781474}
review: Still one of the best trivia games ever, and on equal footing with Volume 1.  The new host isn't as entertaining, but better design and the new Dis or Dat question evens out the value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079214085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1687562828}
review: The game lives up to its name because I stink. The fact is you have so much fun you don't even care how much you're in the hole. You don't know jack is based on a game show (MAKE A LIVE TV GAME OF IT, WHAT'S THE MATTER WITH YOU PEOPLE) lmao. Get to know the game and play it often. One rule: if you don't know the answers I wouldn't guess. The host is really up for proving the motto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014027247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1461472823}
review: A great follow up to Vol. 1 XL and another classic PC game. Pretty similar to Vol 1 in terms of design and layout, but if it ain't broke don't fix it. Well worth the price here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031960991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1443917900}
review:
Filled with Nostaligic trivia from the 90s, its the game i remembered as a kid, but fully understanding the jokes and humor this time around makes it even better

Get this version over the newer one!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975671721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1388641134}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110440078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1387727595}
review: Stop assuming I don't know any Jacks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015500917', 'num_games_owned': 4584, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1385904519}
review:
well i loved the game as retail, when i was young.

now i thought its a nice move from jackbox to publish it on steam.

the sad thing is that they published it without any kind of optimization..

you see the game running in a very tiny window, even if its occupying your whole screen (around the game its just black)
no resolution change, only english language, no steam overlay.

the price is low, but its still not worth it. better get the game as non-steam retail instead.

for steam it gets  a "no" from me, even if the game itself is still great.
